reviewText: I love Bill Bellamy but this one just didn't do it for me. It was ok in the sense that I'm not mad that I bought it, I just hoped it would be as funny as  his first one, Back to My Roots.The subject matter is as the title suggests, but I thought that his delivery could have been better. I collect comedy specials so I do not take it as a loss/waste of time, but if you are just a casual consumer of comedy and are just looking for a good laugh for a night in, go for his first one. Or just try another comedian- Gabriel Inglesias, Chris Rock, Carlin, Gary Owen, or Greg Giraldo.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really like Bill Bellamy. I'll just get that out of the way. I've watched him develop into a pretty good actor through the years (I can't believe Fastlane was a decade ago), but I haven't seen him do stand-up in a very long time. So I was excited to check out this LOL Comedy Showcase filmed at the Saban Theatre in Beverly Hills. Shot before an enthusiastic audience, "Crazy Sexy Dirty" is not as crazy, as sexy, or as dirty as its title might imply--but it is still a thoroughly entertaining hour. Bellamy is no longer a brash young comic, and his performance is flavored with a maturity and a middle-aged viewpoint that works perfectly. This solid set is more about storytelling than about quick one-liners, and Bellamy is an engaging host. His material is not wholly original in concept, but his tales twist around to very unexpected places. One tale of chatroom experimentation has put me off Apple Jacks completely. Thank goodness he stayed away from Sugar Smacks.Whether he's getting his freak on online, enjoying the unexpected pleasures of a good bath time scrubbing, extolling the coolness of flip flops, commenting on celebrity culture, recounting tales of "making it rain" or examining racial differences in the delightfully entitled "White People News"--this concert performance had a little something for everyone. As I mentioned, a few of the ideas are quite familiar. But even when a subject seems well worn, Bellamy can still make it funny. He is an accomplished story teller and a good physical comedian. The material covers a broad array of topics, is adult in nature and language (though not over-the-top), and plays well to both men and women and those of different ethnicities. If you're already a fan, you should enjoy this performance. And if you are not familiar with Bellamy, I think you'll appreciate the universality of this showcase. Certainly not the funniest concert I've seen, but solidly constructed and well worth it! KGHarris, 6/12.
summary: An Engaging And Amusing Storyteller: Bellamy May Be Older, But He's Still Got Charm To Spare

reviewText: Bill Bellamy is consistently funny.  From the first time that I saw him debut on Def Comedy Jam, he has proven that is definitely a comedy giant.  If Bill Cosby and Eddie Murphy could have a son .... he would be it!  I thoroughly enjoyed every moment of this concert, from the comments about Lil Wayne .... to his interpretation of real news in the media.  This was money well spent because this concert will never get old.  A++++ Mr. B!
summary: Real talk all day long ... the truth is hilarious!

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Bill Bellamy performs original material. His topics include:Michael JacksonRappersCaliforniaWhite People NewsDogsAtlanta strip clubTaking a bath and oral sexHis humor uses the F-bomb, but unlike so many of his counterparts does not rely on it. What Bill failed to do was to "bring it home" with the big laugh at the end. Comedians normally try to end on a big laugh by using earlier material and connecting it to the final laugh.
